drupalNodeEvent.title: How China Escaped Shock Therapy: The Market Reform Debate

field_speakers.processed: Isabella Weber (University of Massachusetts Amherst), Puck Engman (University of California, Berkeley)

field_organizers.processed: Li Ka-Shing Foundation Program in Modern Chinese History, University of California, Berkeley

field_description.processed: China has become deeply integrated into the world economy. Yet, gradual marketization has facilitated the country's rise without leading to its wholesale assimilation to global neoliberalism. Isabella Weberâ€™s new book uncovers the fierce contest about economic reforms that shaped China's path.
